intro: Rapanea ralstoniae, commonly known as the Ralston's holly, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in montane forests. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, while its flowers are white or pale pink, attracting various pollinators. Due to its restricted habitat, Rapanea ralstoniae is considered a rare and endangered species.
